stanza.line: Like as to make our appetite more keenkeen
With eager compounds we our palate urgeurge
As to prevent our maladies unseenunseen
We sicken to shun sickness when we purgepurge
Even so being full of your neer-cloying sweetnesssweetness
To bitter sauces did I frame my feedingfeeding
And sick of welfare found a kind of meetnessmeetness
To be diseased ere that there was true needingneeding
Thus policy in love t anticipateanticipate
The ills that were not grew to faults assuredassured
And brought to medicine a healthful statestate
Which rank of goodness would by ill be curedcured
But thence I learn and find the lesson truetrue
Drugs poison him that so feil sick of youyou
